title: 110_s2455
content:
The "Community Foreclosure Assistance Act of 2007" may be cited as the short title. Additional emergency CDBG funding is addressed in the Act. The "Community Foreclosure Assistance Act of 2007" authorizes $1 billion for assistance to States, cities, and counties for community development block grants. Funds are for housing foreclosure impact, economic development, and rental assistance for renters. No funds can be used for homeowner foreclosure prevention. Funds are for housing foreclosure impact, economic development, and rental assistance for renters. No funds can be used for homeowner foreclosure prevention. Additionally, funds may be provided directly to certified housing counseling services approved by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. SEC. 3. INCREASED PUBLIC SERVICES REQUIREMENT CAP.

This Act increases the public services requirement cap from 15% to 25% for all funds appropriated under it.

SEC. 4. LOW AND MODERATE INCOME REQUIREMENT.

At least 50% of the funds under this Act must benefit low- and moderate-income individuals.

SEC. 5. PLANS AND REPORTS. SEC. 5. PLANS AND REPORTS.

Funds under this Act must primarily benefit low- and moderate-income individuals. States, cities, or counties must submit a comprehensive plan for fund usage and quarterly reports to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development can waive certain provisions of statutes or regulations to facilitate the use of funds by States, cities, or counties, except for fair housing, nondiscrimination, labor standards, and environmental requirements. Waivers can be granted if a compelling need is demonstrated. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development may waive the public service requirement cap upon request if a compelling need is shown. Any waiver granted must be published in the Federal Register at least 5 days before taking effect and reviewed every 2 years. The Secretary must also notify the Senate and House Committees on Appropriations. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must notify the Senate and House Committees on Appropriations of any waiver granted or denied under this section at least 5 days before it takes effect. SEC. 7. Noncompliance with community development requirements under this Act will be subject to the provisions of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974. SEC. 8. The Comptroller General will conduct an audit of all funds appropriated under this Act and submit a report to the Senate and House Committees. SEC. 9. Reports must be provided as required. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must report quarterly to the Senate and House Committees on the use of funds, including the number of households receiving counseling and rental assistance, outcomes of assistance activities, certified housing counseling services, steps taken to prevent fraud and abuse.
